entry.title: UseGalaxy.eu update to 21.01
entry.content: UseGalaxy.eu has been updated to 21.01, a few days before the official release. Some highlights of this version: plenty of workflow improvements, the access to remote files interface and the new history panel, together with other user-friendliness enhancements. Enjoy the preview! And if you find issues, please let us know!
entry.summary: UseGalaxy.eu has been updated to 21.01, a few days before the official release. Some highlights of this version: plenty of workflow improvements, the access to remote files interface and the new history panel, together with other user-friendliness enhancements. Enjoy the preview! And if you find issues, please let us know!

entry.title: RADseq data analysis (on mobile phone while baby is sleeping)

link.title: RADseq data analysis (on mobile phone while baby is sleeping)

entry.content:
Yvan Le Bras reminded us today that everyone can analyse RADseq data in Galaxy.

RADSeq combines two simple molecular biology techniques with Illumina sequencing: the use of restriction enzymes to cut DNA into fragments (as for RFLPs and AFLPs), and the use of molecular identifiers (MID) to associate sequence reads to particular individuals. This delivers high-resolution population genomic data — thousands of sequenced markers across many individuals — for any organism at reasonable costs.

Yvan and his team also created some training materials which you can find in the Galaxy Training Network (GTN).

Following #RADseq question on #usegalaxy help forum, I am retrying our training material on last Stacks version on https://t.co/Ydhnaq1889 #PNDB to create a @GEOBON_org #EBV workflow for intraspecific genetic diversity on the cloud & from my smartphone (baby is sleeping ;) ) pic.twitter.com/kShMZhphWx

— Yvan Le Bras (@Yvan2935) March 13, 2021

And using Rule based upload really simplify the process of renaming datasets in the same time we download data from url for this training "RAD-Seq to construct genetic maps" https://t.co/NCuoQ5GZ2D ! Amazing #usegalaxy functionality! I have to update the tuto! pic.twitter.com/pgCuBwqXSA

— Yvan Le Bras (@Yvan2935) March 13, 2021

Have to build a "population map"? No problemo ;) using "text manipulation" tools, I created one directly writing names of datasets on new ones, some "select 1st" "cut columns" "concatenate" & "create column", & capturing this process to a workflow so I can free disk space pic.twitter.com/GzmMQWGD4X

— Yvan Le Bras (@Yvan2935) March 13, 2021

And you know what? You can help adding scientific information to existing #citizenscience data from @VigieNature Spipoll waiting the end of your @GEOBON_org Genetics #EBV workflow execution ;) #GAPARS #PNDB #MOODA #crowdsourcing pic.twitter.com/ru4VjVOUox

— Yvan Le Bras (@Yvan2935) March 13, 2021

After morning #RADseq based Genetic map, now population genomics study in #usegalaxy again with Stacks to generate @GEOBON_org #EBV Genetic differentiation. Data import, quality check of filtered vs unfiltered RAD from 16 samples... In my smartphone screen with my ~🌭 fingers ;) pic.twitter.com/e4yhZCmT8P

— Yvan Le Bras (@Yvan2935) March 13, 2021

Generating a population map "on the fly" copied/pasted on the #usegalaxy data upload interfaces. Then, let's go to build loci and.. did I mention that having the display of the training material inside Galaxy-E #PNDB is ... Amazzing !!! So efficient (notably on phone with 🌭;) )! pic.twitter.com/iBRzpuhGDV

— Yvan Le Bras (@Yvan2935) March 13, 2021
entry.summary: Yvan Le Bras reminded us today that everyone can analyse RADseq data in Galaxy.

entry.title: Successful use cases from EOSC-Life using Galaxy

link.title: Successful use cases from EOSC-Life using Galaxy

entry.content:
The first round of EOSC-Life demonstrators, as part of Work Package 3 has driven eight successful use cases, three of them using Galaxy. The outcomes of these projects have been presented during the webinar series ‘Populating EOSC-Life’ in January 2021.


Demonstrator 1: European Open Science Cloud resources for Chemical Biology and Structure-Based Drug Discovery workflows

The aim of this demonstrator was to to develop a set of tools to increase the FAIRness of chemical biology data and structural data and to enable the integration of structural biology data and chemical biology data to increase access and re-use of resources.


Demonstrator 4: Marine Eukaryote Genomics Portal – access to tools and data-flows for marine genome annotation

This EOSC-Life demonstrator project aimed to develop an online marine genomic resource to aid community driven annotation of marine eukaryotes and help to provide a focus for post-assembly genomic workflows and data access of specific (closely related) groups of marine organisms.


Demonstrator 6: Image Repository and Scaleable Mining

This EOSC-Life pilot project demonstrated the use of such an infrastructure to run new image analysis via the cloud on publicly available image data sets from genome wide screens. As an example case, this project investigated the biology of the nucleolus, a small membrane-less organelle found within the nucleus of the cell.
entry.summary: The first round of EOSC-Life demonstrators, as part of Work Package 3 has driven eight successful use cases, three of them using Galaxy. The outcomes of these projects have been presented during the webinar series ‘Populating EOSC-Life’ in January 2021.

entry.title: The European HealthyCloud consortium kick-off is today!

link.title: The European HealthyCloud consortium kick-off is today!

entry.content:
HealthyCloud (Health Research & Innovation Cloud) is a new European project that aims at improving health research and its translation to healthcare at all levels: from public health to personalised medicine, through secondary use of health data. HealthyCloud will deliver a Strategic Agenda for the implementation of the European Health Research and Innovation Cloud (HRIC).

Galaxy is part of the ecosystem in this project and will contribute towards reproducible analysis and help with distributed computational analysis across Europe.

Check out the press release for more details.

📰#HealthyCloud will define the Strategic Agenda for the #European #Health #Research and #Innovation #Cloud

➡️More info in our press release: https://t.co/8HqXFxDTc0 @CRGenomica @CSCfi @denbiOffice @LUMC_Leiden @uni_lu @saludand @embl pic.twitter.com/qd7hoXyAcS

— HealthyCloudEU (@HealthyCloudEU) March 9, 2021
entry.summary: HealthyCloud (Health Research & Innovation Cloud) is a new European project that aims at improving health research and its translation to healthcare at all levels: from public health to personalised medicine, through secondary use of health data. HealthyCloud will deliver a Strategic Agenda for the implementation of the European Health Research and Innovation Cloud (HRIC).

entry.title: New Paper “ChiRA: an integrated framework for chimeric read analysis from RNA-RNA interactome and RNA structurome data”

link.title: New Paper “ChiRA: an integrated framework for chimeric read analysis from RNA-RNA interactome and RNA structurome data”

entry.content:
Abstract - With the advances in next-generation sequencing technologies, it is possible to determine RNA-RNA interaction and RNA structure predictions on a genome-wide level. The reads from these experiments usually are chimeric, with each arm generated from one of the interaction partners. Owing to short read lengths, often these sequenced arms ambiguously map to multiple locations. Thus, inferring the origin of these can be quite complicated. Here we present ChiRA, a generic framework for sensitive annotation of these chimeric reads, which in turn can be used to predict the sequenced hybrids.

Results Grouping reference loci on the basis of aligned common reads and quantification improved the handling of the multi-mapped reads in contrast to common strategies such as the selection of the longest hit or a random choice among all hits. On benchmark data ChiRA improved the number of correct alignments to the reference up to 3-fold. It is shown that the genes that belong to the common read loci share the same protein families or similar pathways. In published data, ChiRA could detect 3 times more new interactions compared to existing approaches. In addition, ChiRAViz can be used to visualize and filter large chimeric datasets intuitively.

Conclusion ChiRA tool suite provides a complete analysis and visualization framework along with ready-to-use Galaxy workflows and tutorials for RNA-RNA interactome and structurome datasets. Common read loci built by ChiRA can rescue multi-mapped reads on paralogous genes without requiring any information on gene relations. We showed that ChiRA is sensitive in detecting new RNA-RNA interactions from published RNA-RNA interactome datasets.


A new #usegalaxy tool suite from @BackofenLab for chimeric RNAs associated with specific cancer types. ChiRA: an integrated framework for chimeric read analysis from RNA-RNA interactome and RNA structurome data https://t.co/eCjrCqi4Ao pic.twitter.com/LXyOph9TZg

— GigaScience (@GigaScience) March 6, 2021
entry.summary: Abstract - With the advances in next-generation sequencing technologies, it is possible to determine RNA-RNA interaction and RNA structure predictions on a genome-wide level. The reads from these experiments usually are chimeric, with each arm generated from one of the interaction partners. Owing to short read lengths, often these sequenced arms ambiguously map to multiple locations. Thus, inferring the origin of these can be quite complicated. Here we present ChiRA, a generic framework for sensitive annotation of these chimeric reads, which in turn can be used to predict the sequenced hybrids.

entry.title: European Galaxy Server part of CatRIS

link.title: European Galaxy Server part of CatRIS

entry.content:
The European Galaxy Server is now listed in the Catalogue of Research Infrastructure Services (CatRIS). CatRIS is a portal for services and resources provided by Research Infrastructures across Europe.

The European scientific community can find it under the following categories Compute, Software, Services, Applications, Consultancy & Support, Data Analysis, Data Management, Education & Training for different scientific categories. All the different European Galaxy Flavours are also included as use cases.
entry.summary: The European Galaxy Server is now listed in the Catalogue of Research Infrastructure Services (CatRIS). CatRIS is a portal for services and resources provided by Research Infrastructures across Europe.

entry.title: New introductory video to the Galaxy Training Network

link.title: New introductory video to the Galaxy Training Network

entry.content:
Geert Bonamie from VIB Bioinformatics Core, and part of ELIXIR Belgium, has created a fancy video introducing the Galaxy Training Network (GTN).

This formidable video takes us on a journey through the different learning profiles covered in the GTN, the structure that the tutorials follow, the accessibility of all the training material directly from Galaxy, the contributions from the community, and the periodic community CoFests. Please feel free to share it!


Thank you very much for this great contribution to the Galaxy community, Geert!
entry.summary: Geert Bonamie from VIB Bioinformatics Core, and part of ELIXIR Belgium, has created a fancy video introducing the Galaxy Training Network (GTN).
